chunks.en: How should I respond to rural relatives bragging that their second-tier college son earns 12,000 yuan a month as a programmer in Fujian?
Recently, during the Spring Festival return home, I encountered something that made me a little embarrassed.
At a banquet, a relative sitting at the same table kept talking about how great his son was, constantly bragging about his monthly salary of 12,000 yuan, saying his son was very promising.
Actually, I also know that I am not as good as his son, but as a junior college student, I still feel a little embarrassed.
Moreover, the relative's boasting made me feel as if our other children were not as good as his.
Although I was a little dissatisfied, I also knew that I couldn't directly fall out with the relative.
So how should I deal with this situation?
I don't understand.

chunks.en: It's not like they're being sarcastic or subtly scolding you, just simply showing off their child. Because *you* feel uncomfortable, you want to find a way to retort.
It shows that you are sensitive and have low self-esteem. Instead of doing this, you should think about how to make more money.
Directly ask at the dinner table whether you can borrow some money from his son as you are getting married soon (ğŸ¶

Since they are relatives, just go along with their boasting and praise them a bit. PS: Regardless of the actual salary, always say around 10,000 when others ask, which is more in line with rural expectations.

Actually, is it possible that it's your own self-esteem acting up? Maybe the neighbor isn't entirely boasting. Their son, whom they raised with great effort, is successful and earns money, and they share this joy with relatives and friends around them. Perhaps there is no malice in itself, but perhaps rural parents have not received much education and don't understand what impact these words will have on others.

A thousand people have a thousand Hamlets in their hearts. Different mindsets will lead to different results. When you are happy, you feel that flowers, trees, and plants are cheerful and entertaining. When you are sad, everything looks emo.
You are too sensitive, aren't you? It's normal for him to be happy that his son has a high-paying job. You should congratulate him.
For this kind of person, just go along with what he says and praise him, and he will be very happy.
When asked about you, just say you don't earn much money, just barely making ends meet.
Throw the topic back to him.
Actually, the reason why many people can do well in social situations is because they do this: they can chat, and sometimes praising others is really simple, and the effect is really good.
I thought your monthly salary was several times higher than his, and you were afraid that saying it would hurt his self-esteem and be too embarrassing to deal with, but...
His son is probably also annoyed by his bragging, right?
Just take it lightly. A relative's child entered Huawei, and it was really glorious.
The next time I heard about it, he was fired after working for 2 months and became a laughing stock.

The suggestion above about borrowing money is a bad idea. Rural people are not stupid, they are very shrewd and cunning. As soon as you open your mouth, they will know your intentions, and everyone present will be able to see it. They may not have even noticed you, but if you talk about borrowing money, you will be in trouble. Everyone will say something and drown you.
Immediately flip out, overturn the table and leave, and hang yourself at his door the next day.
Praise his son vigorously while working hard to improve yourself.

I suggest that adults who don't want to participate in mutual boasting should not attend this kind of banquet, but if you really want to argue at this kind of banquet, I recommend a few more powerful topics: traditional Chinese medicine, bottleneck, genetically modified.
Keep smiling, don't actively participate in the topic, and if you are called upon, play Tai Chi and say some useless things.
Ordinary people are not the protagonists of novels. If you are at a disadvantage, be patient. You can work hard later, but there is no need to fight back on the spot (unless you have the strength).
Remember, remember, whether you are really poor or pretending to be poor, you must pretend to be poor.
?? No one cued you, why are you so sensitive?
Pretend to be poor
I thought of a sentence a relative asked yesterday. He asked: Is it true that you can't do your job after 33? Do you have to be fired when you reach 33?
Before clicking in, I thought it was his father who mistakenly thought that his son's salary was very high in Fujian, and you were much better than his son and didn't want to embarrass him...
